qas.question: Along with Northumbria, what kingdom was invaded by the Vikings?
Along with the part of Mercia not conquered by the Vikings, what other kingdom was combined with Wessex by Alfred?
What is the modern name for the West Saxon dialect of Alfred's time?
From what language was literature notably translated into West Saxon?
North of what river in Northumbria was the kingdom not overrun by the Vikings?
Who over ran most of Mercia in the 900's?
Who defended Kent from the Vikings?
What became the standard language in the 900's?
What language was West Saxon literature translated to?

context: Each of these four dialects was associated with an independent kingdom on the island. Of these, Northumbria south of the <a4_0>Tyne<a4_0/>, and most of <a0_0>Mercia<a0_0/>, were overrun by the <b5_0>Vikings<b5_0/> during the 9th century. The portion of Mercia that was successfully defended, and all of <a1_0>Kent<a1_0/>, were then integrated into Wessex under <b6_0>Alfred the Great<b6_0/>. From that time on, the West Saxon dialect (then in the form now known as <a2_0><b7_0>Early West Saxon<b7_0/><a2_0/>) became standardised as the language of government, and as the basis for the many works of literature and religious materials produced or translated from <a3_0><b8_0>Latin<b8_0/><a3_0/> in that period.
